document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the subgenus Bessobates of the genus Netelia from Japan (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae, Tryphoninae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the subgenus Bessobates of the genus Netelia from Japan (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae, Tryphoninae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Paniscus ( Parabates ) virgatus
f.
nipponensis
Uchida, 1934

Netelia ( Bessobates ) nipponensis :

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 58–62. Male of
Netelia ( Bessobates ) nanaki
. 58, Head in dorsal view; 59, head in frontal view; 60, mesosoma in dorsal view; 61, fore wing; 62, hind wing.

FIGURES 63–68. Male subgenital plate and genitalia of
Netelia ( Bessobates )
spp. 63–65,
Netelia ( Bessobates ) longipad
; 66– 68,
N . ( B .) nanaki
; 63, 66, subgenital plate; 64, 67, paramere in mesal view; 65, 68, aedeagus in lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph: ♀♂. Head ( Figs 70, 71 ) 1.7–1.8 times as wide as long; vertex in dorsal view subangularly rounded; occiput and interocellar area polished and impunctate; vertex and gena weakly and finely punctate; geno-orbital index 2.0– 2.3 ; frons impunctate and finely coriaceous, without a median longitudinal groove; face 1.4–1.6 times as wide as long, strongly and sparsely punctate; supraclypeal suture deep and distinct; clypeus 2.0– 2.3 times as wide as long, sparsely punctate on dorsal half and impunctate on ventral half, with apical margin truncate and slightly concave medially; antenna with 47–55 flagellomeres, 1 st flagellomere 1.5–1.6 times as long as 2 nd, 2 nd 2.3–2.6 times as long as wide.
Fore tibial spur 0.5–0.6 times as long as the tarsomere, which is 7.1–8.5 times as long as wide; fore tarsal claw with 12–16 (♀) and 16–25 (♂) pectines; hind tarsal claw with 12–14 pectines.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 69–72.
Netelia ( Bessobates ) nigridorsalis
. 69, Female; 71–73, male; 69, habitus in lateral view; 70, head in dorsal view; 71, head in frontal view; 72, mesosoma in dorsal view.

FIGURES 73–74. Wings of male of
Netelia ( Bessobates ) nigridorsalis
. 73, Fore wing; 74, hind wing.

subSubSection.paragraph: Head yellow; interocellar area to upper portion of occiput with blackish-brown marking diverging ventrally and occiput with blackish-brown spot on each side of foramen; antenna light brown. Mesosoma yellow; mesoscutum with brownish-black stripe on each of median and lateral lobes and a brownish-black spot situated behind median stripe; post scutellum and propodeum anterior to propodeal crest brown to blackish-brown; pronotum sometimes with a brown spot on posterior portion near hind corner. Legs brownish-yellow; hind coxa and femur brown to blackish-brown, latter yellowish on ventral surface; hind tarsus whitish-yellow. Wings hyaline, tinged with yellow; vein C and pterostigma of fore wing brownish-yellow, other veins blackish brown. Metasoma brown on tergites, brownish-yellow on episterna and sterna; basal 1 / 3 and apical margin of 1 st tergite and basal corner of 2 nd tergite ochraceous; male genitalia brown.
Ovarian egg 1.0 mm long and 0.5 mm high, with a stalk on posterior end of ventral margin.

Holotype : ♂, Mt. Shiratoriyama ( 1300 m ), Kumamoto Pref.,

(N. Kôda), at light, NIAES .

Korea : 1 ♀, Choanji,
3 . viii. 1924
(T. Kurisue), recorded as
Parabatus virgatus
by
Uchida ( 1928 )
, SEHU .
Distribution. Japan (Hokkaido, Honshu, Shikoku, Kyushu), Korea .

Etymology .
The specific name is based on the darker coloration of dorsal portions of the meso- and metasoma.

Remarks. This new species resembles the moderately pigmented specimens of
N . ( B .) virgata
in coloration, but easily distinguished from it by the vertex which is subangularly rounded off in dorsal view, the short lateral carina of scutellum and the presence of propodeal crest.
Nigridorsalis
shares the shape of vertex with
kiuhabona
, and the shape of digitus and the small hairs on lamina volsellaris with
cristata
. However, the presence of overhang, strip of minutely papillate cuticle and the membranous pad are shared with
virgata
. Thus, this species is thought to be a member of the
virgata
group.
